Kęty [ˈkɛntɨ] is a town in Oświęcim Coun: The town located in Silesian Foothills dates its earliest document from 1277 when Polish prince of Opole Władysław confirmed sale of the settlement and adoption of Lviv city rights. The town's name comes from the word kąt (Polish for corner). The greatest development of the town came under the rule of Jagiellons
Lesser Poland Voivodeship: when the town became royal property.The son of the mayor of the town of Kenty
Poland with 18: Stanislaus Bacenga and his wife Anna became the Saint John Cantius
also known as John (Johann) of Kraków.
